title: Big questions: How concerning is Cowboys' D? Did Chiefs' offense find something?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: Source: RB Conner suffers season-ending injury
content: Cardinals running back James Conner suffered a season-ending right ankle injury during Sunday's loss to the 49ers, and he will require surgery, a source told ESPN.

title: Chiefs get 1st win as Reid brushes off Kelce dustup
content: Chiefs coach Andy Reid brushed off his sideline dustup with Travis Kelce on Sunday night as Kansas City picked up its first win of the season, beating the Giants.

title: Syracuse fined for faking injuries vs. Clemson
content: The ACC fined Syracuse $25,000 and publicly reprimanded the school for faking injuries in a 34-21 win over Clemson last weekend, calling its actions "unethical and contrary to the spirit of the rules."

title: Sources: 3 repeat foes for SEC 9-game schedule
content: The SEC on Tuesday will release its nine-game schedule for 2026, which will feature three repeat opponents set in place for the next four seasons.

title: Chargers' Harris carted off with Achilles injury
content: Chargers running back Najee Harris had what preliminary tests revealed was an Achilles injury during Sunday's 23-20 win against the Denver Broncos, coach Jim Harbaugh said after the game.

title: Wilson booed amid chants for Dart in Giants' loss
content: The Giants fell to 0-3 on Sunday with a 22-9 loss to the Chiefs. Russell Wilson, who threw two interceptions, endured chants of "We want Dart!" from the crowd, as fans made it clear they want to see rookie Jaxson Dart under center.

title: Mayfield calls Jets win personal, points to Wilks
content: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield didn't hold back when asked about the significance of a 29-27 victory over the Jets on Sunday.

title: OSU lands S Smith, brother of star Buckeyes WR
content: Class of 2027 safety Angelo Smith, the brother of Ohio State star wide receiver Jeremiah Smith, has committed to the Buckeyes, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: üìà Ranking MLB playoff pitching rotations by tiers
content: Aces matter in the postseason. Here are the contenders who are flush with them -- and which are lacking quality arms.

title: Indiana‚Äôs rise, Clemson‚Äôs face-plant and more we didn‚Äôt see coming
content: Four weeks in, there's no real favorite to win it all or take home the Heisman. Here's what we think we know.

title: Battle for the AL Central: An improbable Guardians comeback and epic Tigers collapseÔªø
content: With a week left in the regular season, Detroit and Cleveland are separated by one game atop the division.

title: How Dan Campbell's 'kneecap speech' forever changed the NFL and the Detroit Lions
content: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

title: The VAR Review: Explaining Bruno Fernandes' 'offside,' Robert S√°nchez's red card, Newcastle's penalty claim
content: Looking at Robert S√°nchez's red card for Chelsea at Manchester United, a possible offside on Bruno Fernandes' goal and a potential penalty.

title: How the Fever stunned the Aces and stole Game 1 in the WNBA semifinals
content: Kelsey Mitchell and Indiana stunned Las Vegas in Game 1. What's next for both teams in the WNBA semifinals?

title: Dowman? Ngumoha? Yamal? Predicting the 2035 Men's Ballon d'Or
content: What were players doing 10 years before they won soccer's greatest individual prize? Ryan O'Hanlon gets his crystal ball out to see which current rising star will lift the Ballon d'Or in 2035.

title: Pete Carroll is accountable for losses, but will he make changes?
content: The promising start of the Carroll era with the Raiders has taken a negative turn. How will Carroll react?

title: Ranking Week 3 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 3's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Fantasy Buzz: Trey Benson next man up and who got the ball on Sunday
content: Trey Benson will get an opportunity to start, and a deeper look at player trends you need to know from Sunday.

title: Ranking Aces star A'ja Wilson's four WNBA MVP seasons
content: A year ago, A'ja Wilson played arguably the best season in WNBA history. Where does her 2025 MVP season rank?

title: Offseason survey: Best and worst moves, LeBron's future and Finals picks
content: League insiders share their picks for the Finals, most head-scratching moves of the summer and LeBron's next decision.

title: Risers, questions and notes: Could USC have two high-pick receivers?
content: What are scouts saying about Makai Lemon? Is Fernando Mendoza now ready for the QB1 title? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 3.

title: WNBA coaching tracker for 2026: Storm part with Noelle Quinn
content: The WNBA coaching carousel starts with openings at Seattle, new teams Portland and Toronto. Check out expert analysis on the latest updates.

title: Ryan Blaney, Penske dominate in second round of Cup playoffs
content: Ryan Blaney opened the second round of the NASCAR Cup Series playoffs with an emphatic victory for Team Penske.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Marta's Orlando Pride in nine-game rut
content: Orlando have stretched their winless rut to a calamitous nine straight games and are desperately clinching on to a playoff position. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea back in for Maignan to replace S√°nchez
content: Chelsea are ready to make a fresh move for AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Betting buzz: Browns, Panthers end big underdog losing streak
content: After underdogs failed to make much noise in the first two weeks of the NFL season, that all changed in Week 3.

title: College football betting: Indiana's blowout of Illinois was no fluke
content: Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet on the Indiana Hoosiers after their 63-10 win over No. 9 Illinois.

title: Harry Styles goes sub-three in Berlin
content: Reportedly racing under the pseudonym "Sted Sarandos," Styles clocked 2:59:13 and took a finish-line photo with Paralympic champion Richard Whitehead.

title: üèÄ Inside Kawhi Leonard's tumultuous time in L.A.
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: üîü Barnwell ranks every winless NFL team
content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

title: At Sabarimala Samrakshana Sangamam, Annamalai mounts attack on Pinarayi, Stalin
content: Former BJP Tamil Nadu president criticizes Kerala and Tamil Nadu CMs at Sabarimala event, accusing them of opposing Sanatana Dharma.

title: 11 institutions become carbon negative in Kerala
content: Kannur Central Jail is the latest institution to join the list. The listing is based on a carbon emission audit carried out by Haritha Keralam Mission

title: CM praises Kerala Police for leading in law enforcement, social responsibility
content: He says projects such as HOPE and SPC are strong examples of how the police can shape a better society by taking responsibility to uplift lives and instil civic values

title: CM directs officials to speed up land acquisition for highway projects
content: Officials should adopt humanitarian approach and explain affected families about benefits of highways

title: Encroachment cleared for Bengaluru suburban rail project in Yelahanka
content: Following the clearance, boundary stones were installed by K-RIDE and Railway officials, and the land was formally handed over to K-RIDE to begin construction of the corridor

title: Cusat denies links with Profcon
content: University says it has not hosted or endorsed any event by the name Profcon as part of the Wisdom conference in Mangaluru or any other location

title: Watch: Modi unveils development projects in Arunachal Pradesh, slams Congress
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Arunachal Pradesh on Monday, unveiling development projects worth over ‚Çπ5,100 crore. He also criticised Congress for neglecting development in the Northeast, saying the party abandoned difficult projects and caused significant harm.¬†

title: Pawan Kalyan calls for strengthening AP Pollution Control Board
content: Deputy CM stresses need for pollution control without hindering industry, seeks transparency amid allegations against APPCB officials and concerns over Godavari river contamination

title: Kerala HC directs CAT to consider maintainability of petitions filed by IAS officer
content: Petitions filed by senior IAS officer B. Ashok who had challenged the State government transferring him from the post of Principal Secretary, Agriculture, and the Agricultural Production Commissioner

title: New GST rates trigger political tussle between BJP and Congress
content: The heralding of the new GST regime with reduced rates witnessed a political tussle in Karnataka with the BJP challenging the Congress government to reduce its taxes to respond to the Centre‚Äôs gesture, while the Congress accused the Centre of looting people in the last eight years through high GST rates and being responsible for the closure of many MSMEs¬†

title: Seer refuses to quit Panchamasali Peetha saying trust has no authority to oust him
content: Sri Basava Jaya Mrutyunjaya Swami, meanwhile, hints at plans to set up a new peetha for the community

title: North Karnataka has fewer specialist doctors and the issue needs focus, says Bommai
content: He was speaking after inaugurating the Swastha Naari, Sashakt Parivaar campaign at the Community Health Centre in Guttal of Haveri district

title: üí∞ Could a salary cap really come to baseball?
content: There are two words MLB and the MLBPA simply cannot agree on. Here's how it got this way and what it means for the next CBA.

title: üèà Why doesn't NFL every team use tush push?
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: ‚öæ Dodgers' Clayton Kershaw to retire after season
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: üé§ Johnson: Not giving 'trade secrets' to Brady
content: Ben Johnson isn't worried about divulging information that can be used against the Bears when he participates in production meetings with Tom Brady.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Four-team mock draft strategy: When to draft Tkachuk, Kucherov and others
content: Four-team leagues are rising in popularity, so our experts mock drafted their teams for a H2H points league.

title: Supreme Court judge flags need for performance evaluation mechanism for judges
content: Justice Kant, who is next in line to be the Chief Justice of India, underscored the value of introspection in every institution

title: Watch: SC criticises June 12 Air India crash report, seeks impartial investigation
content: The Supreme Court raised concerns over the AAIB‚Äôs preliminary report on the June 12 Air India flight AI171 crash that killed 260 people, including 19 on the ground.

title: Lokayukta, police accused of shielding accused policemen in bribery case
content: Shiv Sena State president Siddalinga Swami of Andola Mutt says the Principal Sessions Court has rejected the bail plea of the accused

title: Madras High Court stays transfer of government paediatrician, who undertook a march demanding pay parity
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira stays the transfer from Chennai to Nagapattinam and records that the doctor would be accommodated in Tiruvallur in the interregnum

title: Bathukamma floral waste to become biowaste in Warangal
content: With significant amounts of floral waste generated in residential areas and community centres, the safe disposal of this flower waste has become a pressing concern, as it is often carelessly dumped into waterbodies

title: Kerala CM inaugurates ‚ÄòVikasana Sadassu‚Äô initiative of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: Over next month, in the run up to local body elections, a series of events will be held across the State to popularise the achievements of local bodies

title: MGU to launch Small Animal House and amoebic research facility
content: Facility will be the second-largest Small Animal Research Centre in Kerala and can house up to 2,000 mice and 2,000 rats

title: Like Lalu Prasad, Hemant Soren will also be punished for scams and ‚Äòlooting‚Äô Jharkhand, says Babulal Marandi
content: Mr. Marandi claimed that wealthy mafias from Chhattisgarh to NCR Delhi, who were granted bail by failing to file timely chargesheet in liquor scam, are rumoured to have embezzled over ‚Çπ100 crore

title: Hakki Pikki community members take out protest march seeking enumeration
content: They are demanding that they be included in the social and educational survey being conducted by the Backward Classes Commission now

title: Tirupati MP seeks CBI, Supreme Court probes into Tirumala Parakamani controversy
content: Andhra Pradesh government has made ‚Äúunsubstantiated allegations‚Äù of theft and misuse of offerings at Tirumala without credible evidence or impartial investigation, he says

title: PM Modi inaugurates newly developed infrastructure, beautification works at Tripura Sundari Temple
content: Narendra Modi offered puja in accordance with rituals at the 523-year-old temple founded by Maharaja Dhanya Manikya; during the rituals, tribal devotees presented traditional Kirtan

title: BJP warns of protests by Dalits against govt. adding the word Christian to Hindu castes
content: The word Christian that has been tagged with Scheduled Castes has still not been removed, says district unit president Basavaraj Vibhutihalli

title: Corning‚ÄìSGD Pharma JV opens $60-million glass tubing plant near Hyderabad¬†
content: Production expected to touch 13,000 tonne capacity by early 2026, enough to make around 2.2 billion vials a year

title: Time-honoured traditions of Navaratri unfold at Mysuru palace
content: A heritage inherited from the rulers of the Vijayanagara empire, the scion of the erstwhile royal family and MP for Mysuru Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar, led the celebrations with an elaborate series of religious rites supervised by a battery of priests well-versed in palace customs

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Shevadhi Museum, Alliance University join hands to research palm leaf manuscripts at centuries-old Kumaranalloor Devi temple
content: The manuscripts, currently undergoing preservation at the museum within the temple complex, were recovered from the attic of the temple office last year.

title: New GST reforms to boost savings, benefit all sections of society, PM tells citizens
content: Narendra Modi said the new reforms simplify the system, and small business, shopkeepers, traders, manufacturers, and MSMEs will experience greater ‚Äúease of doing business‚Äù and ‚Äúease of compliance‚Äù

title: Perumbalam bridge to open by December 2025, says Daleema Jojo
content: The bridge itself has been completed and work on the approach roads on the Perumbalam and Vaduthala sides is progressing

title: KSRTC deploys 350 extra buses for Mysuru Dasara rush
content: The buses, supplementing regular operations, will primarily operate on the Bengaluru route and neighboring districts to bring visitors to Mysuru

title: Congress victory in Jubilee Hills byelection licence for bulldozer govt. to raze homes of poor: KTR
content: BRS working president alleges that HYDRAA is going on demolition drives on court holidays despite HC order

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister urges people to buy Made-in-India products, says GST 2.0 will boost growth
content: Naidu says reduced GST rates and zero tax on essentials will benefit small businesses and put more money in the hands of common people. The State government plans 65,000 awareness programmes from Dasara to Deepavali to highlight the new rates

title: Govt extends ban imposed on National Socialist Council of Nagaland (K) for five more years
content: The extension of the ban is because of NSCN (K)‚Äòs involvement in activities prejudicial to the sovereignty and integrity of India, MHA said

title: Supreme Court judge says it‚Äôs high time to decriminalise defamation
content: The remark mirrors the apex court‚Äôs anxiety over the ramped-up use of the criminal defamation law, and reopens the question as to whether ‚Äòdefamation of any person by a private person can be treated as a ‚Äòcrime‚Äô, for it does not subserve any public interest‚Äô

title: Trump tariffs: Why India didn't react to 50% duty immediately? Rajnath Singh reveals
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh stated that India didn't immediately retaliate to the US's 50% tariff due to its broad-mindedness. He expressed confidence that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) will eventually become part of India without aggressive action, as its residents are demanding freedom. Singh recalled stating five years ago that PoK would itself want to join India.

title: Zubeen Garg's second post-mortem tomorrow after public demand: Assam CM
content: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, the state's iconic singer, who passed away in Singapore on September 19. Following public requests, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has ordered a second post-mortem to be conducted at Guwahati Medical College. The funeral will proceed with full state honors on the outskirts of Guwahati.

title: GST 2.0 kicks in: Firms lower prices, eye bumper sales; consumers set to gain this festive season
content: Indian companies are reducing prices, exceeding GST cuts, to boost consumer demand during the festival season. Businesses across various sectors, from food to footwear, are implementing new price tags and informing distributors. While some sectors express concerns, most anticipate increased sales volumes due to lower prices, with industry bodies ensuring the benefits reach consumers.

title: PM Modi's open letter to citizens: GST 2.0 to accelerate progress of every state
content: Prime Minister Modi announced the 'GST Bachat Utsav,' highlighting the benefits of reduced GST rates for households and businesses. The reforms, effective from September 22nd, feature primarily 5% and 18% tax slabs, lowering taxes on essential goods. These changes, combined with income tax cuts, aim to save citizens approximately Rs 2.

title: Sudha Murthy files FIR: Unknown caller threatens with obscene videos; probe under way
content: Sudha Murty, a Rajya Sabha MP, has reported a cybercrime. She received a threatening call from an unidentified individual. The caller posed as a telecom employee. He claimed her mobile number wasn't linked to Aadhaar. He also mentioned the circulation of obscene videos. The caller threatened to halt her mobile services. Murthy filed a police complaint in New Delhi.

title: China‚Äôs answer to H-1B: K-visa live Oct 1; who can apply
content: Amidst concerns over Trump's new H-1B visa fee, China introduces the K-visa, set to launch on October 1, 2025. This new visa aims to attract young, skilled STEM professionals globally by offering flexibility, eliminating the need for employer sponsorship, and encompassing a broad range of activities like education, research, and entrepreneurship.

title: Why are Pakistan players avoiding Indian media?
content: Pakistan cricket faces criticism for on-field struggles and media handling, particularly regarding Indian journalists. After losses to India in the Asia Cup, the Pakistan captain avoided press conferences, leading to controversy. When a press conference finally occurred, only Pakistani journalists were allowed to ask questions, highlighting biased media management. The situation raises questions about Pakistan's willingness to face tough questions.

title: Appointed, ignored & unpaid: Meet India's 'invisible' teachers
content: Across India, tens of thousands of teachers work without fair pay, job security, or recognition. Some have waited decades for a salary. Others left the profession broken. A recent Supreme Court verdict granted long-overdue parity to a group of Gujarat teachers ‚Äî but for thousands more, justice remains out of reach.

title: '5,000 yrs of discrimination': Akhilesh on UP order; flags casteist symbols, mindset
content: Following Allahabad high court's directive to eliminate caste-based discrimination, Uttar Pradesh government ordered removal of caste references from police records and public notices. Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav questioned the Yogi Adityanath government's commitment to eradicating deeply entrenched caste discrimination. He further inquired about measures to address caste-based biases in social interactions and practices, beyond just official documentation.

title: H-1B visa hike: ‚ÄòDo not live in fear,‚Äô says Zoho founder to Indians in US
content: Following a massive H-1B visa fee hike by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu advises Indian tech professionals in America to return to India and rebuild their careers. Drawing parallels with the Partition, he emphasizes India's growing opportunities and the potential for success, suggesting this reverse migration could strengthen India's tech ecosystem.

title: 'Agar main Pakistan ka coach bana': Rohit Sharma's comment goes viral after Ind vs Pak
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive innings propelled India to a six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four stage, marking their second win against their rivals in the tournament. The match was notable for the continued absence of handshakes between the teams, reflecting ongoing political tensions.

title: START agreement: Putin says Russia will adhere to nuclear treaty for ‚Äòone more year‚Äô
content: President Vladimir Putin announced that Russia will extend its adherence to the New START nuclear warhead agreement with the United States for another year, until February 2026. He emphasized the importance of the treaty for global stability and urged the US to reciprocate by also adhering to its limits.

title: 'Main bhi Bharat hoon': Rajnath Singh says 'PoK will be ours on its own'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh addressed the Indian community in Morocco. He stated that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir will be a part of India without any aggressive actions. He mentioned that the people of PoK are unhappy and want freedom. He also addressed the US tariff issue, stating that India does not react immediately. He said broad-minded people do not react immediately.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Musk recalls his journey, says ‚ÄòI‚Äôm in America via H-1B‚Äô
content: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike in the US, an old post from Elon Musk defending the program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited the H-1B visa for his own success and the growth of companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

title: Brain health boost: 3 simple exercises to rewire your mind; improve focus
content: Research indicates that activities like dance, martial arts, and team sports significantly enhance cognitive function beyond traditional workouts. These complex movements stimulate the brain, improving memory, attention, and decision-making skills. Studies reveal measurable brain changes, including increased gray matter and improved executive functions, highlighting the potential for lifelong brain development through enriched physical activity.

title: Asia Cup: Abhishek Sharma's 'L' celebration against Pak: Who was it aimed at?
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 off 39 balls against Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four propelled India to a dominant six-wicket victory. His blistering innings, featuring the fastest half-century by an Indian against Pakistan, set the stage for an easy chase of 172. India now lead the table in the Super Fours stage.

title: Honda Cars get GST price cuts- Here are model-wise details
content: Honda Cars India has announced revised prices across its lineup following the implementation of GST Reforms 2025. Effective from September 22, 2025, the new pricing structure brings down the cost of popular models like the Amaze, City, and Elevate.

title: Ba***ds of Bollywood: NHRC seeks action over Ranbir Kapoor e-cigarette scene
content: Aryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' faces legal trouble as the NHRC seeks an Action Taken Report from the I&B Ministry and Mumbai Police. A complaint alleges Ranbir Kapoor's cameo features him using a banned e-cigarette without warnings, potentially influencing young viewers negatively. The complainant, Vinay Joshi, argues the scene promotes illegal activities and disrespects the law.

title: 'Maarna vs ragad ragad ke dhona': Ex-cricketer's fiery reaction after Ind thrash Pak
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74 propelled India to a dominant six-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup Super Four clash. Chasing 172, India's openers, Abhishek and Shubman Gill (47), forged a blistering 105-run partnership, dismantling Pakistan's bowling attack.

title: 'GST Bachat Utsav': PM Modi interacts with traders and entrepreneurs in Tripura
content: Prime Minister Modi engaged with local artisans and entrepreneurs in Tripura and Itanagar, highlighting the benefits of new GST reforms and the 'GST Bachat Utsav' for key sectors. He laid the foundation for development projects in Arunachal Pradesh and inaugurated the redeveloped Tripureswari Temple in Tripura, emphasizing the importance of 'Made in India' products and Northeast development.

title: ‚ÄòWill you give up the foreign jet you roam around in?‚Äô Kejriwal on PM‚Äôs 'swadeshi' push
content: Arvind Kejriwal criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call for Swadeshi, questioning Modi's own use of foreign goods, including his airplane. AAP MP Sanjay Singh accused Modi of hypocrisy, citing his reliance on international brands while advocating for indigenous products. These remarks followed Modi's address urging citizens to prioritize Made in India products and promote Swadeshi in every home and shop.

title: Elon Musk on H-1B visas: Former holder, system critic; balancing reform and talent
content: Elon Musk, once an H-1B visa holder himself, champions the program for enabling his success with Tesla and SpaceX by attracting global talent. While acknowledging its crucial role in filling skill gaps, Musk criticizes the H-1B system as "broken," advocating for reforms like higher salary thresholds to prevent misuse and protect domestic workers.

title: AK-47 celebration: Was there a hidden message? Pak's Sahibzada Farhan reveals
content: Pakistani opener Sahibzada Farhan's AK-47 celebration after reaching his half-century against India has stirred controversy. Farhan defended his spontaneous gesture, stating, "It was just in the moment." Despite his aggressive approach and a quickfire fifty, India secured a strong six-wicket victory. India now leads the Super Fours stage, while Pakistan finds itself at the bottom of the standings.

title: Delhi Ramleela committee signs Poonam Pandey; BJP, VHP seek replacement
content: The Luv Kush Ramleela Committee's decision to cast Poonam Pandey as Mandodari in their upcoming Ramleela performance has sparked controversy, drawing criticism from the BJP and VHP. These groups are demanding her replacement due to her past controversies and social media presence. While the committee remains open to discussions, they defend their choice, emphasizing that everyone deserves a chance.

title: MHA: NSCN declared unlawful association; ban effective from September 28
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs has declared the National Socialist Council of Nagaland (Khaplang), including all its factions, wings, and front organizations, as an unlawful association for a period of five years, effective from September 28, 2025.

title: US H-1B visa fee hike: Indian IT firms facing $150-550 million in immigration bill
content: Indian IT companies face rising costs due to a sharp increase in US H-1B visa fees. This could significantly impact their profits. Firms may increase offshoring and local hiring to mitigate the effects. Project timelines could be disrupted. Clients may also bear some of the increased costs. Alternative talent models like remote work may become more common.

title: Delhi riots case: SC notice on Umar Khalid, Sharjeel's bail plea
content: The Supreme Court has deferred a hearing on the bail pleas of Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, who are accused in the 2020 Delhi riots case. Both were denied bail by the Delhi High Court, which cited the gravity of their alleged roles in the conspiracy behind the violence.

title: Kelce & Reid: From fiery sideline clash to TV buzz; questions rise over Chiefs duo
content: Kansas City Chiefs faced New York Giants. The game saw a heated argument between coach Andy Reid and Travis Kelce. This happened during the second quarter. The Chiefs had managed only two field goals by halftime. Kelce had only two catches. The team has faced back-to-back losses. Pressure is mounting on the Chiefs to improve.

title: ‚ÄòForced to pay Rs 10,000 bar bill‚Äô: Hyderabad student dies by suicide, uploads video
content: A 19-year-old engineering student in Hyderabad tragically died by suicide, alleging extortion by friends. He claimed they forced him to pay a Rs 10,000 bar bill after a party in Medipally. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide, extortion, and violation of the SC&ST Act against the suspects, who are currently being sought.

title: Jacqueline Fernandez‚Äôs plea dismissed: SC refuses to intervene in Rs 200 crore case
content: Jacqueline Fernandez faces a setback as the Supreme Court declines to interfere with the money laundering case involving alleged conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. The court upheld the Delhi High Court's decision to dismiss Fernandez's plea to quash the Enforcement Directorate's proceedings. Fernandez maintains her innocence, claiming false implication in the Rs 200 crore case.

title: 'Bowlers are scared of him': Sehwag praises Sharma's batting after Ind vs Pak
content: Virender Sehwag lauded Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting in India's Asia Cup victory against Pakistan, highlighting his aggressive intent and ability to capitalize on scoring opportunities from the very first ball. Sehwag emphasized Sharma's consistent high strike rate, which instills fear in bowlers and forces them to reconsider their strategies. Sharma's fearless approach has proven instrumental in India's success.

title: Kerala: Man kills wife while she was bathing; goes live on Facebook with confession
content: In Kollam, a tragic incident unfolded as Shalini was allegedly murdered by her husband, Isaac, at their Koothanadi residence near Punalur. Following the gruesome act, Isaac confessed to the crime via a Facebook Live video, citing distrust and accusations of jewellery misappropriation.

title: Usain Bolt to light up football pitch in Mumbai on October 1; fans ecstatic
content: Usain Bolt, the eight-time Olympic gold medalist, world record holder, and global sporting icon will trade his running spikes for football boots in a one-of-a-kind spectacle in Mumbai on October 1. Taking centre stage, the fastest man on earth will light up the pitch in an exclusive football showcase alongside top teams and players, as per a release from PUMA.

title: GST 2.0 is here! What the new tax reforms mean for you - 10 things to know
content: Effective September 22, 2025, the Modi government's GST 2.0 simplifies taxation with two slabs (5% and 18%), benefiting households, businesses, and farmers. Essentials become cheaper, life insurance is GST-free, and healthcare costs decrease. Consumer durables, housing materials, and auto sectors also see reduced GST, boosting affordability and domestic manufacturing.

title: Air India crash: SC questions preliminary report suggesting pilot error
content: The Supreme Court has expressed serious concerns regarding the AAIB preliminary report on the Air India crash, deeming some aspects "irresponsible." Notices were issued to the Centre and DGCA following a plea for an independent probe, highlighting potential conflict-of-interest concerns due to the probe panel's composition and allegations of withheld critical information, including flight data.

title: UP man strangles girlfriend, dumps body in Yamuna; clicks selfie with suitcase
content: Kanpur police have apprehended two men, Suraj and Ashish, for the murder of 20-year-old Akanksha, whose body was allegedly dumped in the Yamuna River. Akanksha, who befriended Suraj on Instagram, was reportedly strangled after a dispute. Suraj confessed, revealing he and Ashish disposed of the body in a suitcase.

title: Gold rate today: Prices hit fresh lifetime highs of Rs 1.11 lakh/10 grams
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices soared to record highs in domestic futures trading, reaching Rs 1.11 lakh per 10 grams, mirroring global trends as investors await US inflation data and Federal Reserve statements. Silver futures also surged, driven by investment flows and industrial demand, with analysts forecasting further price increases. A weaker rupee and geopolitical tensions further supported bullion's rise.

title: Asia Cup scenarios: How Pak can still qualify for final, face India for 3rd time
content: India and Bangladesh have commenced their Super Fours journey in Asia Cup 2025 with victories, India defeated Pakistan by six wickets, fueled by Abhishek Sharma's explosive 74. Bangladesh secured a four-wicket win against Sri Lanka. Pakistan face a must-win situation against Sri Lanka to keep their final hopes alive.

title: India vs Pak: 'Won the battle' - Haris Rauf's wife adds to off-field drama
content: Even as India continued their unbeaten run against Pakistan in the Asia Cup, off-field drama has grabbed headlines. Haris Rauf, who made a jets crashing gesture coupled with a 6-0 sign, has found support from his wife who posted about it on social media. On the field, India had an easy time of beating Pakistan and keeping themselves unbeaten in the tournament.

title: Retired Jamia music teacher rescued, wife found dead; son, 50, trapped alone in flat
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Jamia Nagar, police discovered the body of a 65-year-old woman, Aftab Jehan, in her apartment. Her husband, Siraz Khan, 70, was found in critical condition and rushed to AIIMS. Their son, Imran, who has a history of psychiatric illness, was present but unresponsive.

title: Hyderabad cabbie assaults man over cancelled ride, forces victim to touch feet
content: In Hyderabad, a Rapido driver allegedly assaulted a passenger at AIG Hospital after a fare dispute. Balaji, the victim, cancelled the ride when the driver demanded extra money. The driver, along with associates, confronted Balaji, physically assaulted him, and filmed the incident.

title: Jharkhand Woman Stabs Husband To Death Over Money, Phone
content: A woman allegedly stabbed her husband to death at their home following a dispute in Jharkhand's Jamtara district.

title: 2 Gaza Hospitals Forced To Stop Operations As Israeli Offensive Escalates
content: The Gaza health ministry said two Gaza City hospitals have been taken out of service due to Israel's escalation of its ground offensive and damage caused by continued Israeli bombing, as tanks advanced deeper into the territory.

title: Plea Seeks Removal Of Afzal Guru, Maqbool Bhatt's Graves From Tihar Jail Premises
content: A plea has been filed in the Delhi High Court seeking directions to remove the graves of terrorists Mohammad Afzal Guru and Mohammad Maqbool Bhatt, who were awarded death penalty and executed in Tihar jail.

title: In Hoax Call, MP Sudha Murty Warned Of Misuse To Access Obscene Content
content: Rajya Sabha MP and philanthropist Sudha Murty received a hoax call, during which she was warned that her mobile phone was being misused for accessing obscene content.

title: UP Bans Caste-Based Rallies, 'Politically Motivated' Events After Court Order
content: The Uttar Pradesh government has ordered the immediate removal of all caste references from police records and public notices, and instructed that vehicles displaying caste-based stickers or slogans be fined under the Motor Vehicles Act.

title: Adani Group Firms' Combined Market Valuation Jumps Rs 1.78 Lakh Crore In 2 Days
content: Adani Group companies continued to rally on Monday, adding Rs 1.78 lakh crore in market valuation in two days, propelled by heavy buying in listed stocks following markets regulator Sebi's clean chit in the Hindenburg case.

title: Lalu Yadav's Daughter Unfollows Him, Brother Tejashwi On Social Media Ahead Of Polls
content: The rift within Rashtriya Janata Dal patriarch Lalu Yadavs family continues to make headlines ahead of the assembly polls in Bihar, when it is essential for the Opposition parties to show a united front.

title: Nigerian Man Gets 10 Year Jail In 2012 Heroin Trafficking Case In Tamil Nadu
content: A special court in Coimbatore has convicted a Nigerian national in a narcotics case dating back to 2012, sentencing him to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment and a fine of Rs 1 lakh.

title: PM Modi Unveils Infra Projects Worth Over Rs 5,100 Crore In Arunachal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled infrastructure projects worth Rs 5,125.37 crore in Arunachal Pradesh on Monday.

title: "Her Dreams Are Too Big": Top Court Raps Woman For Rs 5 Crore Alimony Demand
content: The Supreme Court recently took a strong exception to a woman seeking Rs 5 crore alimony for the dissolution of a marriage that lasted for one year and two months.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How Trump's $100,000 Visa Bill Can Bleed Indian Tech Giants Dry
content: This crisis should spark a fundamental reimagining of India's innovation strategy. Instead of primarily serving as a source of talent for American companies, India needs to become a destination for global innovation investment.

title: "Who Has Control?" Experts Question Albania's AI-Generated Minister
content: Last week, Albania announced that an AI-generated minister would take charge of a new public tenders portfolio.

title: Pune Professor Forges Letter To Claim Prestigious Science Award; Arrested
content: A chemistry professor of a Pune-based college has been arrested for allegedly forging a letter claiming he was selected for a prestigious science award instituted by the Ministry of Science and Technology, police said on Monday.

title: 'Why Are You Even Here?' Siddaramaiah Loses Cool During Mysuru Dasara Event
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah lost his cool during the inauguration event of the Mysuru Dasara.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates Redeveloped Tripureswari Temple In Tripura
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday inaugurated the redeveloped Tripureswari temple in Tripura's Gomati district and offered prayers at the shrine.

title: Hostel Administrator Arrested For Sexually Assaulting 9-Year-Old Girl
content: A nine-year-old girl was sexually assaulted, allegedly by the man running the hostel she was staying in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district.

title: Man Duped Into Paying Rs 60 Lakh To Help Son Clear Civil Services Exam
content: Police arrested a man and are searching for his accomplice for allegedly defrauding a Mumbai hotelier of around Rs 60 lakh by falsely assuring him that they would help his son pass the UPSC exam.

title: India's Smartphone Exports To US Falling: Think Tank
content: India's smartphone exports to its largest market, the US, fell 58 per cent from USD 2.29 billion in May to USD 964.8 million in August, think tank GTRI said on Monday.

title: Explained: What Wider Recognition Of Palestine Means For Palestinians, Israel?
content: Several more countries are expected to formally recognise a Palestinian state at a world summit convened on Monday by France and Saudi Arabia, a day after Australia, Britain, Canada and Portugal took the step, angering Israel.

title: Top Court Notice To Cops On Bail Plea Of Umar Khalid, 7 Others In Delhi Riots Case
content: The Supreme Court on Monday sought Delhi Police's response on the bail pleas of activists Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, Gulfisha Fatima, and Meeran Haider in the UAPA case related to the alleged conspiracy behind the February 2020 riots in Delhi.

title: Baku has Verstappen smelling blood in the water, McLaren hearing 'Jaws' theme
content: Max Verstappen wins the Azerbaijan Grand Prix . the Dutchman finishes ahead of George Russel in second and Carlos Sainz in third . f1's 2025 title fight is a sloppy weekend for the team .

title: Home Run Watch: After hitting No. 58, will Raleigh reach 60?
content: Cal Raleigh whacks a home run to give the Mariners a 7-0 lead . the catcher has already surpassed the record for home runs by a catcher and a switch-hitter . he's now at 58 home runs and on pace for 60 with seven games left .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: the WNBA semifinals are underway, and the sixth-seeded Indiana Fever made a statement in the opening game . the higher seed will host games 1, 2, 5 and 7 for the first time . it will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) .

title: Derrick Henry's next-level stiff-arm: 'If it's against me, I want it to be illegal'
content: Derrick Henry is one of the NFL's all-time great running backs . if he gets one-on-one with a would-be tackler when the Ravens play the Detroit Lions on Monday night . his signature stiff-arm has helped him become a running back .

title: Why Packers' offensive struggles in loss to Browns could be long-term concern
content: right tackle Zach Tom aggravated the oblique injury that kept him out the previous week . the big problem was an afternoon-long struggle for Jordan Love & Co . love was sacked five times, tying for the most in his career, while Jacobs rushed for only 30 yards .

title: Barnwell: Ranking Week 3's most infuriating losses, starting with the Packers' massive upset
content: the Texans and texans went home feeling as if they were robbed or threw away a game in which they were the better team . the frustrating losses hit another level after a week of frustrating defeats . 'the bill Barnwell Show' is a 'frustrated show' of the loss .

title: Wrestlepalooza grades: Did Rhodes-McIntyre, Cena-Lesnar get above-average marks?
content: the era of WWE Premium Live Events kicked off with Wrestlepalooza from Gainbridge Fieldhouse in Indianapolis . a new women's world champion was crowned as Stephanie Vaquer defeated Iyo Sky in an excellent showdown . the card also featured the return of former WWE Divas Champion AJ Lee .

title: Missed opportunities for Arsenal, Manchester City in matchup of title contenders
content: arsenal drew 1-1 with Manchester City at the Emirates Stadium on sunday . erling Haaland's first-half equalizer saw the gunners draw 1-1 . sergio aguero's side had a 2-0 lead at the emirates .

title: Yogi Berra, the Yankees and the biggest game of catch ever
content: new: volunteers hand out souvenir baseballs at the "YMCA" on a Sunday . new: "Yogi loved bringing people together," says a former baseball player . he treated every interaction much like a game of catch .

title: College football Power Rankings: How the Top 25 looks through Week 4
content: Alabama's trip to Georgia is a must-win for the Crimson Tide . the state of quarterback play among the contenders is becoming clearer . some of the nation's biggest offseason question marks have emerged as surprise stars .

title: Week 4 takeaways: Missouri shouldn't be overlooked; Ole Miss has depth at quarterback
content: we take a look at some surprising performances and where change could be needed . what changes might Clemson coach Dabo Swinney have to make in the offseason? what do they need to do to push themselves into college football playoff conversations?

title: 60K club: Aaron Rodgers jumps to sixth all time, Matthew Stafford eyes ninth
content: Aaron Rodgers became the ninth quarterback to throw for 60,000 regular-season passing yards . he threw for 245 yards in the win against the Houston Texans . the los Angeles Rams chose to rest him ahead of their playoff run .

title: Latest projections for all 46 postseason CFB games
content: the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 . this season's national championship game will be played in the new year's six bowls .
